documents.title: Brown v. Board of Education
documents.content: In Brown v. Board of Education (1954), the Supreme Court ruled unanimously that racial segregation of children in public schools was unconstitutional. The Court overturned Plessy v. Ferguson (1896), which had allowed state-sponsored segregation.

documents.title: Miranda v. Arizona
documents.content: Miranda v. Arizona (1966) was a landmark decision of the U.S. Supreme Court. The Court held that the Fifth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution requires that law enforcement officials advise suspects of their right to remain silent and to obtain an attorney during interrogations while in police custody.

documents.title: Elements of Contract Law
documents.content: A valid contract requires offer, acceptance, consideration, and mutual intent to be bound. The offer must be clear and definite, acceptance must be unequivocal, consideration must have value, and both parties must intend to create legal relations.
